meanings.definition: Wild and noisy disorder or confusion; uproar.
meanings.sent1: The children's birthday party turned into pandemoniums with all the screaming and running around.
meanings.sent2: When the fire alarm went off, pandemoniums broke out in the office as everyone rushed to the exits.
meanings.sent3: Trying to organize the chaotic classroom was like trying to calm a storm of pandemoniums.
meanings.sent4: As the concert reached its peak, the crowd erupted into pandemoniums of cheers and applause.
meanings.sent5: The marketplace was filled with pandemoniums as vendors shouted to attract customers.

meanings.definition: A place or scene of riotous uproar or utter chaos.
meanings.sent1: The abandoned amusement park was a pandemoniums of broken rides and overgrown weeds.
meanings.sent2: In the midst of the protest, the town square became a pandemoniums of shouting and signs.
meanings.sent3: The kitchen after the baking contest was a pandemoniums of flour and sugar everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The battlefield was a pandemoniums of clashing swords and battle cries.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house was a pandemoniums of eerie sounds and flickering lights.
